title: Kim Jerray-Silver
text:
Kimberley "Kim" Jerray-Silver (born 10 June 1977) is a former English international <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a>er. She was a full–time professional player with <a href="Fulham%20L.F.C.">Fulham</a>, whom she joined from <a href="Arsenal%20L.F.C.">Arsenal</a>.
Football career.
Club.
Jerray-Silver won the 1995–96 <a href="FA%20Women%27s%20Premier%20League%20Cup">FA Women's Premier League Cup</a> with <a href="Barnet%20L.F.C.">Wembley Ladies</a>. In the final against <a href="Doncaster%20Rovers%20Belles%20L.F.C.">Doncaster Belles</a>, she came on as a second-half substitute. The game finished 2–2 before Wembley won on <a href="penalty%20shootout">penalties</a>.
International.
In May 1996 Jerray-Silver won a solitary <a href="England%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">England</a> cap in a 3–0 <a href="1997%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Championship%20qualification">Euro qualifying</a> win over <a href="Portugal%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Portugal</a> at <a href="Griffin%20Park">Griffin Park</a>.
Personal life.
Jerray-Silver became a <a href="firefighter">firefighter</a> and was among the first on the scene at <a href="Edgware%20Road%20tube%20station%20%28Circle%2C%20District%20and%20Hammersmith%20%26amp%3B%20City%20Lines%29">Edgware Road</a> during the <a href="7%20July%202005%20London%20bombings">7 July 2005 London bombings</a>.
